extx.p: "Try not. Do - or do not. There is no try." -- Master Yoda
"So certain, are you? Always with you, it cannot be done. Hear you nothing that I say?" -- Master Yoda

lcn.p: Oh - so often we have this tendency to assume things are impossible without good reason to reach this conclusion. In these situations, of course, we have ourselves firmly convinced that our reasons for naysaying the possibility are in fact true.

Indeed there exist things that truly are impossible. But let us not underestimate how many things that are not truly impossible yet are nonetheless rendered impossible merely by our insistence that they are impossible.

In these cases, to say "I will try" is merely code for "I will make a gesture of trying so as to prove my point that it can not be done". That is not truly trying. That is not-doing disguised as trying -- and in those situations, the only alternative to this not-doing is to do.
When you try, try in earnest. Otherwise, do not bother trying at all - for half-trying is a total waste.
